page.title: 16Cowtons' Social Concerns
page.content: One of the main concerns in North Cowton is the fall in the number of children attending the village school. Attendances have fallen from over 60 to 32 this year. One reason is the high prices of houses in the village. They are often bought by older people with no young family, or young couples who do not intend to start a family. Parents with young children cannot afford to buy the houses, and there is no local employment to attract them. If the trend continues, the school might have to be closed. Another cause for concern in both villages is vandalism, caused by young people, who perhaps have little else to do. Youths driving their cars at speed around the village green late at night cause disturbance to residents. Dogs fouling the pavements is annoying and nobody has yet been fined for this
